intro: Chamaeiris spuria var. danica, commonly known as the Danish fireweed, is a flowering plant native to northern Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas or disturbed sites. It has slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. This variety is known for its hardiness and ability to thrive in challenging environmental conditions.
